recipes.title: Lo-Cal Molasses Cookies

winePairing.pairingText: Cream Sherry, Madeira, and Prosecco are great choices for Cookies. Sweet bubbly Prosecco doesn't overwhelm simple sugar or shortbread cookies, a sweet cream sherry complements spiced cookies, and madeira's nutty notes match cookies with nuts perfectly. One wine you could try is NV Solera Cream Sherry. It has 4.5 out of 5 stars and a bottle costs about 17 dollars.

productMatches.title: NV Solera Cream Sherry
productMatches.description: The Solera Cream Sherry has a brilliant amber and deep copper hue. With butterscotch and pecan aromas, the sweet salted nut and brown spice aromas carry a complex caramel accent. A sweet entry leads to a rounded, lush, moderately full-bodied palate with a lengthy, flavorful finish.

recipes.instructions: Directions                                                                                In a bowl, beat oil, molasses, 1/4 cup sugar and egg.  Combine flour, baking soda, cinnamon, ginger and cloves; add to molasses mixture and mix well.  Cover and refrigerate for at least 2 hours.                                                                                             Shape into 1-in. balls; roll in remaining sugar.  Place on ungreased baking sheets. Bake at 375° for 10-12 minutes or until cookies are set and surface cracks.                                        Yield: 5 dozen.                                                                                                                         Originally published as Lo-Cal Molasses Cookies in  Taste of HomeOctober/November 1998, p17                                                                                                                                                                                                        Nutritional Facts                                                                             One cookie equals 41 calories, 2 g fat (0 saturated fat), 4 mg cholesterol, 44 mg sodium, 5 g carbohydrate, 0 fiber, 1 g protein. Diabetic Exchanges: 1/2 starch.                                                                                                                                                                    Print                                                                                    Add to Recipe Box                            Email a Friend

steps.step: In a bowl, beat oil, molasses, 1/4 cup sugar and egg.
Combine flour, baking soda, cinnamon, ginger and cloves; add to molasses mixture and mix well.  Cover and refrigerate for at least 2 hours.
Shape into 1-in. balls; roll in remaining sugar.
Bake at 375° for 10-12 minutes or until cookies are set and surface cracks.
